meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of slapstick comedy.
meanings.sent1: The movie had a slapsticky feel with all the funny falls and silly pranks.
meanings.sent2: The clown's slapsticky performance had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The children put on a slapsticky play for their parents, complete with exaggerated gestures.
meanings.sent4: Her slapsticky antics at the party made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's slapsticky routine left the audience in stitches.

meanings.definition: Involving physical humor or exaggerated actions.
meanings.sent1: The cartoon characters engaged in slapsticky behavior throughout the episode.
meanings.sent2: The actor's slapsticky movements added a comedic touch to the scene.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to have a slapsticky contest to see who could make the silliest faces.
meanings.sent4: The slapsticky gestures of the mime artist were both entertaining and impressive.
meanings.sent5: The slapsticky skit involved lots of funny falls and over-the-top reactions.

meanings.definition: Playfully humorous or silly in a physical way.
meanings.sent1: The children's slapsticky antics kept the audience entertained for hours.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's slapsticky jokes had everyone in the room chuckling.
meanings.sent3: The slapsticky dance routine brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The slapsticky performance at the circus was a hit with both kids and adults.
meanings.sent5: The slapsticky humor in the movie made it a favorite among comedy fans.
